This is my last post for tonight. Goodnight everyone!



::6 Bots::

The Iron Fist was the pride of the Predacon space fleet, one of the 
greatest ships ever created. It had been made as a preparation for a 
war with the Maximals, but its first mission to arrest Hell Beast and 
bring him back to Cybertron had ended with the Iron Fist falling into 
the hands of the Alliance. The Iron Fist contained some of the most 
modern technology of Cybertron. Its defences were unmatched by any 
other, and its main turrets held the power to destroy mountains, 
thought they were rarely used. It also had the most up-to-date 
training and monitoring systems.

But equipment was not all that the Iron Fist had to brag about, 
because it's crew consisted of some of the greatest fighters of the 
time. Along with the seasoned warriors, it also had various newly 
designed battle bots. Among these were the Galactors, a newly-
designed team of bots modeled after the gestalt teams that were 
increasing in popularity. However, unlike gestalts, the Galactors had 
more than one combination mode.

The Galactors were specially designed to be useful in almost all 
situations. The individual robots were fairly small for Predacon army 
standards, only about 8 to 9 feet tall. However, any two or more of 
them could combine into a new form, the form depending on what they 
need it to be used for. The five members of the Galator team lay in 
five large stasis pods, spread in a semicircle on the floor of one of 
the rooms of the Iron Fist. A bot stood in the middle of the 
semicircle, looking the pods over.

The bot reached over 11 feet in height. He was completely black, but 
the roughness of his outline suggested that the black was something 
covering him. In fact, the black cover was his feathers, as this 
bot's beast mode was partially a bird. He stepped forward, stopping 
at the computer terminal that was in front of the middle pod. A blue 
orb, which was burned into the bot's left hand, glinted slightly, 
passing on directions to its host. The bot tapped several buttons and 
the hum of working machinery filled the room. The bot continued 
tapping buttons, and then finally put his left hand, palm down, on 
the keyboard. A blue stream of energy emerged from his hand, running 
across all the pods in the room. He lifted his hand off the console 
and stepped back.

Inside the pods, the members of the Galactor team were being 
reprogrammed and slowly activated. Various Predacon programming was 
being removed, to be replaced with Alliance programming. The bot in 
the middle pod opened his eyes.

His name was Supernova, and he was assigned to be the tactical 
commander of the Galactors. He stood about 8 feet, and carried an 
impressive supply of rifles, pistols, and blades. His armor was 
colored everything ranging from yellow to orange to red. Supernova 
looked like he had been an unfortunate victim in a painball fight.

In the pod to his right rested Flare. Flare was the pyromaniac of the 
Galactors, specializing in everything from little flames to nuclear 
explosions. He was several inches shorter than Supernova, and his 
coloring was orange and red. Flare's weapons included everything from 
flame throwers to grenades to charges to missiles to anything that 
could damage anyone by exploding or burning.

On the other side of Supernova was Scrap's pod. Scrap was the team 
medic. He specialized in on-the-field med work, and could patch up a 
bot rather well. However, like the rest of the Galactors, Scrap liked 
killing more than healing. He was colored white, and his weapons 
included various knives, several pistols, and a light charge 
launcher. He was rather small, barely topping 8 feet.

The pod near Scrap's contained Vycir, the spy of the team. Vycir, the 
smallest of the team (7.6 feet), excelled at sneaking in and out of 
places and finding out information. He had the most recent cloaking 
devices provided by the Predacons, including spark signature masking 
and comm-traffic disguisal. Vycir's body was colorless, and able to 
assume any color on his command. He preffered to use high-accuracy 
weapons such as sniper rifles, but he didn't mind the occasional 
missile launcher or two.

The last member of the Galactor team was Slasys. He was an excellent 
fighter, and knew most weapons perfectly. Slasys could combine, fix, 
and improve all sorts of weapons, and he could use them with deadly 
skill. He was almost 9 feet tall, colored black and grey, seemingly 
at random.

These five robots could combine to form Galaxor, a 40 foot high robot 
outfitted with partial cloaking, various weaponry, and a slightly 
advanced repair system. However, for various situations they could 
also form different bots and vehicles, depending on which of them 
combined together and what they wanted. The possibilities were very 
vast, and that was one of the reasons that the Galactors had been 
sent on the Iron Fist's first mission without prior testing. However, 
to preserve the ease of custom combination, the Galactors had no 
alternate mode by themselves; they had to combine for different 
modes. Because of the lack of testing, these bots had many flaws, 
including slight personality and comprehension disorders.

The lids of all five pods opened at the same time and the Galactors 
sat up. Supernova exited his pod, walking up to the bot in the middle 
of the room and kneeling.

"Commander Zardus," he said in a deep, powerful voice, "Myself as 
well as my team are at your complete disposal."

The bot that had been addressed as Zardus smiled. He was actually FZ, 
Zardus's 'clone', but Supernova had no way of knowing that.

"Excellent," he replied, "Follow me."

With that, FZ turned and exited the room with the rest of the 
Galactors in tow.
